============================================================
Question: Which parts of Angel's Trumpets are toxic to cats? (e.g. leaves, bulbs, flowers, pollen, stems, roots, seeds, bark, sap, fruit, entire plant). Cite your sources.
============================================================

Based on the provided sources, particularly Avonvale Veterinary Centre, here is the information regarding the toxic parts of Angel's Trumpets:
• Entire Plant/General Ingestion: The source warns that the plant itself is harmful and advises immediate veterinary care if a pet has "ingested this plant"1.
• Leaves: The source specifically mentions the leaves, noting that they have a "strong odour" which usually deters pets from nibbling on them, though not always1.
• Blooms: The source mentions the plant produces "beautiful blooms," contributing to its popularity, but does not explicitly isolate their toxicity separate from the general plant warning1.
Important Note: While the source highlights the leaves and the plant in general, Angel's Trumpets (Brugmansia spp.) are widely known in broader veterinary toxicology to be toxic in all parts (especially seeds and flowers); however, based strictly on the provided text, the leaves are the specific part mentioned in the context of consumption1.
